Author: wookie#7663
Content:
should I do: 
git checkout jl777
git pull

to get the keystrokes.log?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: @TonyL gameinfo shows the baton, which would be the registration txid at first, then as each new keystrokes tx is made, it updates the baton. maybe what is happening is that the tx goes into the mempool, but then it doesnt confirm? querying for the batontxid and doing a getrawtransaction/sendrawtransaction until it confirms should make things a lot more reliable

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: @wookie once you do the bailout without any keystrokes file, the player is dead. so the TUI needs to make sure to never send a bailout if the baton is the registration txid

Author: wookie#7663
Content: Is that something that needs to be fixed in the TUI? Or is this something I can do? Sorry, I'm not a coder, don't really understand what needs to be done.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if you are using TUI, wait for new TUI.

Author: wookie#7663
Content: ok, thanks! üëå

Author: TonyL#3577
Content:
@barv `running ./zcutil/build.sh -j$(nproc) on branch jl777 gets me into trouble again: `
Just built very latest fine.
In komodo folder try to 
```git pull
make clean
cd src
rm -rf komodod komood-cli komodo-tx *.so
cd cc 
rm -rf *.so
cd ../..
./zcutil/build.sh -j$(nproc)```

Author: TonyL#3577
Content:
Ah one more reason might be on your side.
Try to ```git fetch
git reset --hard```
after `git pull`

Author: TonyL#3577
Content:
https://github.com/tonymorony/komodo_cryptoconditions_tui/releases/tag/0.11n updated Ubuntu and OSX ROGUE bundles
Changes since 0.1n :
```
- Quite critical fixes in komodod rpc for bailout/baton searching process which allows to not loose warriors/game progress in some cases

- TUI checking for ROGUE.conf in daemon folder and copying it if needed
- TUI waiting for chain sync before the start
- TUI setting valid pubkey automatically if no pubkey set in daemon start params```
